intro: Hibbertia auriculiflora subsp. auriculiflora, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. The plant has woody stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and dry inland regions. Hibbertia auriculiflora subsp. auriculiflora is a member of the Dilleniaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance.
